channel.title: Handling Jad. [PI]
channel.description: So my server has an issue when fighting Jad.. It doesn't know how to handle him (her? it?). [Oh the jokes that can be made] I've added the correct attack emotes and the correct death emotes. But he will stand there for a second, and turn invisible on walking, and then invisible again once he starts an attack. Only being visible when he's standing. What could be a fix for this?

item.title: Handling Jad. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

insinity:

need help with this…

It might be because of the animations. If he only bugs out when performing an animation (walking, attacking) it’s a plausible explanation. Possibly something in the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Handling Jad. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Oh I missed that one cause it’s named:

		case FightCaves.TZTOK_JAD:
			if (goodDistance(npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY,
					PlayerHandler.players[npcs[i].spawnedBy].absX,
					PlayerHandler.players[npcs[i].spawnedBy].absY, 1))
				r3 = Misc.random(2);
			else
				r3 = Misc.random(1);
			if (r3 == 0) {
				npcs[i].attackType = 2;
				npcs[i].endGfx = 157;
				npcs[i].projectileId = 448;
			} else if (r3 == 1) {
				npcs[i].attackType = 1;
				npcs[i].endGfx = 451;
				npcs[i].projectileId = -1;
			} else if (r3 == 2) {
				npcs[i].attackType = 0;
				npcs[i].projectileId = -1;
			}
		break;

Read full topic

item.title: Handling Jad. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

case 2745: int r3 = 0; if (goodDistance(npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].spawnedBy].absX, Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].spawnedBy].absY, 1)) r3 = Misc.random(2); else r3 = Misc.random(1); if (r3 == 0) { npcs[i].attackType = 2; npcs[i].endGfx = 157; npcs[i].projectileId = 1627; } else if (r3 == 1) { npcs[i].attackType = 1; npcs[i].endGfx = 451; npcs[i].gfx100(1625); npcs[i].projectileId = -1; } else if (r3 == 2) { npcs[i].attackType = 0; npcs[i].projectileId = -1; } break;

Tell me if that works, in my server it is working fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Handling Jad. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

	public int getDeadEmote(int i) {
		switch(npcs[i].npcType) {
			case 2745://Jad
			return 2654;
			case 2745://Jad
			if (npcs[i].attackType == 2)//Mage
			return 2656;
			else if (npcs[i].attackType == 1)//Range
			return 2652;
			else if (npcs[i].attackType == 0)//Melee
			return 2655;

I think the reason for this is because he is too big, like when he is walking it cant get all of his body, so when he stops it can show all of it (sounds confusing) I had this same problem, i suggest you try to update models? not sure, gl.

No, it works in other PI’s. The animations are wrong.
[/quote]
can i see your code?[/quote]

Death or attack. There in cases…
